status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
After an instance is restored in managed mode it is no longer possible to SSH to it. To reproduce configure a MANAGED mode cloud to restore instances and reduce the timeouts:

{code}
#
# euca-modify-property -pcloud.vmstate.instance_timeout=2m
PROPERTY	cloud.vmstate.instance_timeout	2m was 180d
#
#
# euca-modify-property -pcloud.vmstate.unknown_instance_handlers=restore
PROPERTY	cloud.vmstate.unknown_instance_handlers	restore was terminate-done, restore-failed
#
#
# euca-modify-property -pcloud.vmstate.vm_initial_report_timeout=120
PROPERTY	cloud.vmstate.vm_initial_report_timeout	120 was 300
#
#
{code}

Run an instance with a provided SSH key and verify that you can SSH to it.

Stop the node controller (service eucalyptus-nc stop) on the node running the instance and wait for it to be terminated.

Once terminated, restart the node controller (service eucalyptus-nc start) and wait for the instance to be restored. When the instance is "running", attempt to SSH to it:

{code}
# ssh -i .ssh/id_rsa2 root@10.111.30.163
ssh: connect to host 10.111.30.163 port 22: No route to host
{code}

The network information looks OK for the instance:

{code}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>

      <value>10.111.31.70</value>

fields.summary: EC2 instances unreachable after instance restore

comments.body:
This issue manifests when NC is stopped but eucanetd remains running.
When CLC marks the VMs as terminated, these instances will be gone from GNI.
When NC comes back, the first GNI it receives will cause eucanetd to remove the SGs bridges (this will disconnect the VMs' network interfaces).
An updated GNI with the restored instances will make eucanetd to create the bridges back, but VMs network interfaces will remain disconnected.
Currently there is no logic in the code to connect VM network interfaces to bridges (it is done by libvirt based on the instance's xml config when it is instantiated).

This problem can be avoided by shutting down eucanetd together with NC, and only restart eucanetd once restored instances are "running".

Given a workaround and the rarity of hitting this, moving it to 4.2.1.

Also, the current instance timeout is 180 days, so this behavior in MANAGED mode is not unreasonable after that duration without contact from the NC. This condition is only hit if that timeout is hit, not during a normal NC service restart or downtime shorter than 180 days.
[~tsugawa], do we want to do anything for this in 4.3?
[~dmitrii], it is likely that we will not have cycles for this.
